chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall (n1 : nat) (y : Z), addZ (pos (S n1)) y = succZ (addZ (pos n1) y)

Premises:
succZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => IZ | pos n => pos (S n) | neg 0 => OZ | neg (S m) => neg m end : Z -> Z
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Inductive Z : Set := OZ : Z | pos : nat -> Z | neg : nat -> Z Arguments pos _%nat_scope Arguments neg _%nat_scope
addZ = fun x1 x2 : Z => match x1 with | OZ => x2 | pos n => addpos x2 n | neg n => addneg x2 n end : Z -> Z -> Z
addZ_eq2 : forall y : Z, addZ (pos 0) y = succZ y
addZ_eq1 : forall y : Z, addZ OZ y = y
Nat.divmod_spec : forall x y q u : nat, u <= y -> let (q', u') := Nat.divmod x y q u in x + S y * q + (y - u) = S y * q' + (y - u') /\ u' <= y
tech_pred_posZ : forall n : nat, 0 < n -> predZ (pos n) = pos (Init.Nat.pred n)
eq_S : forall x y : nat, x = y -> S x = S y
f_equal_nat : forall (B : Type) (f : nat -> B) (x y : nat), x = y -> f x = f y
Z_rect : forall P : Z -> Type, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z
Z_rec : forall P : Z -> Set, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z
Z_sind : forall P : Z -> SProp, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z
Z_ind : forall P : Z -> Prop, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z
Fin.FS_inj : forall x y : Fin.t ?n, Fin.FS x = Fin.FS y -> x = y where ?n : [ |- nat]
succ_predZ : forall x : Z, succZ (predZ x) = x
tech_succ_posOZ : forall n : nat, succZ (posOZ n) = pos n
succ_pred_pred_succZ : forall x : Z, succZ (predZ x) = predZ (succZ x)
addpos = fix addpos (x2 : Z) (n : nat) {struct n} : Z := match n with | 0 => succZ x2 | S n0 => succZ (addpos x2 n0) end : Z -> nat -> Z Arguments addpos _ _%nat_scope
VectorSpec.shiftrepeat_last : forall (A : Type) (n : nat) (v : VectorDef.t A (S n)), VectorDef.last (VectorDef.shiftrepeat v) = VectorDef.last v
Eqdep_dec.UIP_refl_nat : forall (n : nat) (x : n = n), x = eq_refl
Ndigits.Bv2N_Nsize_1 : forall (n : nat) (bv : Bvector.Bvector (S n)), Bvector.Bsign n bv = true < -> BinNat.N.size_nat (Ndigits.Bv2N bv) = S n
VectorDef.hd = fun A : Type => @VectorDef.caseS A (fun (n : nat) (_ : VectorDef.t A (S n)) => A) (fun (h : A) (n : nat) (_ : VectorDef.t A n) => h) : forall (A : Type) (n : nat) (v : VectorDef.t A (S n)), (fun (n0 : nat) (_ : VectorDef.t A (S n0)) => A) n v Arguments VectorDef.hd {A}%type_scope {n}%nat_scope
VectorSpec.shiftrepeat_nth : forall (A : Type) (n : nat) (k : Fin.t (S n)) (v : VectorDef.t A (S n)), VectorDef.nth (VectorDef.shiftrepeat v) (Fin.L_R 1 k) = VectorDef.nth v k
VectorDef.last = fun A : Type => @VectorDef.rectS A (fun (n : nat) (_ : VectorDef.t A (S n)) => A) (fun a : A => a) (fun (_ : A) (n : nat) (v : VectorDef.t A (S n)) (H : (fun (n0 : nat) (_ : VectorDef.t A (S n0)) => A) n v) => H) : forall (A : Type) (n : nat) (v : VectorDef.t A (S n)), (fun (n0 : nat) (_ : VectorDef.t A (S n0)) => A) n v Arguments VectorDef.last {A}%type_scope {n}%nat_scope
Nat.testbit_succ_r : forall (a : nat) (b : bool) (n : nat), Nat.testbit (2 * a + Nat.b2n b) (S n) = Nat.testbit a n
VectorDef.tl = fun A : Type => @VectorDef.caseS A (fun (n : nat) (_ : VectorDef.t A (S n)) => VectorDef.t A n) (fun (_ : A) (n : nat) (t : VectorDef.t A n) => t) : forall (A : Type) (n : nat) (v : VectorDef.t A (S n)), (fun (n0 : nat) (_ : VectorDef.t A (S n0)) => VectorDef.t A n0) n v Arguments VectorDef.tl {A}%type_scope {n}%nat_scope
Fin.rectS : forall P : forall n : nat, Fin.t (S n) -> Type, (forall n : nat, P n Fin.F1) -> (forall (n : nat) (p : Fin.t (S n)), P n p -> P (S n) (Fin.FS p)) -> forall (n : nat) (p : Fin.t (S n)), P n p
Init.Nat.divmod = fix divmod (x y q u : nat) {struct x} : nat * nat := match x with | 0 => (q, u) | S x' => match u with | 0 => divmod x' y (S q) y | S u' => divmod x' y q u' end end : nat -> nat -> nat -> nat -> nat * nat Arguments Init.Nat.divmod (_ _ _ _)%nat_scope
